abstract: Federal government releases report on homeless veterans that finds only halting progress made by the Obama administration, who had set goal of ending homelessness by 2014; study shows that while number of veterans who uses emergency shelters or transitional housing dropped 3 percent, they continue to account for 13 percent of all homeless adults.
snippet: The report underscored the Obama administration’s halting progress toward fulfilling its pledge to end homelessness among veterans by 2014.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

lead_paragraph: The report underscored the Obama administration’s halting progress toward fulfilling its pledge to end homelessness among veterans by 2014.

headline.main: Study Finds Slight Decline in Veterans Using Shelters
headline.print_headline: Study Finds Slight Decline In Veterans Using Shelters
